channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TX
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TX

item.title: Report E-2023100221
item.description:
Report E-2023100221

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-07
  • City: SAN ANTONIO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LSX experienced a UN3082 Permafil 74041 release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of product released to a 20’ x 15’ area of the dock floor due to a puncture. The product was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area and then collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized into a 95-gallon poly overpack. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023100201
item.description:
Report E-2023100201

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-06
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LDA experienced a UN1866 Vinyl Ester Resin release from (2) 250-gallon poly totes. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct containment and cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 cup of product released to the tote body only of each tote. The caps were replaced, and a slosh test conducted to ensure there would be no further release. The totes were wiped down for shipment on. All impacted rags, the damaged caps, and PPE were containerized into a 5-gallon poly pail. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023100185
item.description:
Report E-2023100185

  • City: ABILENE

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into one of the metal 55 gallon drum of paraffin dispersant (un1993) releasing 3 gallons of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023090612
item.description:
Report X-2023090612

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-06
  • City: SAN ANTONIO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: AM UNLOAD PACKAGE HANDLER UNLOADED PACKAGE AT UNLOAD DOOR AND WHEN PLACING ON ROLLERS NOTICED CHLORINE LEAKING FROM BOX ALERTED OPS MGR ROLANDO ALVAREZ WHO THEN ALERTED OPS MGR ROXANNE LARA HAZMAT WAS COLLECTED WITH PROPER SAFETY EQUIPMENT AND INSPECTION WAS COMPLETED. DescribePack: NO VISIBLE DAMAGE TO PACKAGE, WHEN OPENING AND REMOVING GALLON BUCKET FROM BOX A CRACK WAS THEN NOTICABLE DUE TO THE SHIFT IN SOLID CAUSING A CREASE IN THE PLASTIC FOR THE CRACK TO THEN REVEAL ITSELF. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: BUCKET WAS PLACED IN HAZMAT SAFE BAG THEN PLACED IN BOX AND HAZMAT BOX WAS PLACED IN HAZMAT DRUM

ALL MATERIALS PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM AND ZIP TIED.

item.title: Report X-2023090538
item.description:
Report X-2023090538

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-05T15:12:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-06
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was received from unload unit to QA work area with bottom of box saturated in an unknown liquid substance. The package was placed in a black plastic container housing the leaking liquid substance coming from the bottom of package. DescribePack: Upon opening the package with regulate PPE in place there were liquid solution coming from one of four plastic gallon bottles. The top was not secured tight contributing t liquid leakage from bottle throughout the package and other remaining contents. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in a plastic container

item.title: Report X-2023090535
item.description:
Report X-2023090535

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-05T15:12:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-06
  • City: LUBBOCK
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found wet on one side and was immediately removed from delivery process DescribePack: the 20 liter capacity box was wet so was the 10 liters one inside it. There was a very small hole at the bottom of the 5L bottle where the peroxyacetic acid mixtures was slowly leaking and nothing could stop the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was immediately removed from the delivery process and was put into designated damage hazmat packages containers.
